isis.stitle: New Vehicle Processing Manual - CF 500, CF 600 Heat Ventilation Air Conditioning (HVAC) System - SERVICE PROCEDURES - REFRIGERANT IDENTIFICATION

svcproc.title: REFRIGERANT IDENTIFICATION

warning.para: Before doing any of the work below, read the SERVICE WARNINGS. Failure to read the Service Warnings and to be aware of the dangers involved when working with refrigerant could lead to serious personal injury.

important.para: Although your service equipment may appear physically different from the equipment shown here, the function of the equipment used to perform each service procedure is basically the same. If you are performing these service procedures using service equipment different from that shown, refer to the manufacturer's instructions supplied with that equipment.

svcproc.para: Before any work is done on an HVAC system the refrigerant in the system must be identified.

step1.para: Calibrate the Refrigerant Identifier per the manufacturer's instructions.
Connect the sampling hose to the low pressure service port located on the compressor manifold and tube near the evaporator fitting.
Connect the other end of the sampling hose to the Refrigerant Identifier.
Start the sampling procedure (refer to the manufacturer's instructions).

When the sampling is complete the Refrigerant Identifier will indicate a pass/fail condition, the type of refrigerant, and the percentage of concentration. International recognizes only R134a in a 98% concentration. Anything else is considered contaminated.
If contaminated refrigerant is detected, repeat the test to verify that the refrigerant is indeed contaminated.
Close the service valve and disconnect the sampling hose.

caution.para: If contaminated refrigerant is detected, DO NOT recover the refrigerant into R-134a recovery/recycling equipment.

note.para: If this equipment described below is not available, contact an A/C service facility in your area with the correct equipment to carry out this service.

item.para: Recover the contaminated refrigerant using suitable recover-only equipment designed for capturing and storing contaminated refrigerant only.
Determine what repairs are necessary and make the repairs.
Flush and purge the system. Refer to FLUSHING AND PURGING THE AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEM.
Dispose of the contaminated refrigerant in accordance with all federal, state and local regulations.
